benchmark_details.name: Debate-Driven Evaluation for QA
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents a debate-driven evaluation paradigm that transforms existing QA datasets into structured adversarial debates, enhancing the difficulty and assessing reasoning capabilities of models while addressing issues like data contamination.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To offer a sustainable and effective path for evaluating the genuine reasoning ability of advanced language models through structured debate.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The study primarily employed only 50 MMLU-Pro questions, limiting domain-specific analysis reliability.

data.source: Structured debates derived from MMLU-Pro questions
data.size: 5,500 debates totaling over 11,000 rounds of argumentation
data.annotation: Arguments were generated based on a structured debate protocol.

methodology.calculation: Win counts are aggregated for reproducible, order-independent rankings.
methodology.interpretation: A higher total win count indicates stronger reasoning capabilities of the model.
methodology.baseline_results: Empirical results were collected from various models including DeepSeek V3 and Claude 3.5 Sonnet.
methodology.validation: The methodology was validated through extensive empirical experiments with multiple models.
